info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Schenectady, northern Albany, southwestern Saratoga and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 143 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Duanesburg, or 7 miles west of Scotia, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rotterdam Junction and Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction around 155 PM EDT. Rotterdam and Glenville around 200 PM EDT. Scotia around 205 PM EDT. Schenectady and East Glenville around 210 PM EDT. Clifton Park, Niskayuna, Alplaus, Burnt Hills and Country Knolls around 215 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Glenridge, Hoffmans, Harding Crossing, Gifford, Garrison Manor, Aqueduct, Princetown, Woodruff Heights, Elnora and Schonowe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 24 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 25 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 near exit 8A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
